<h2>About</h2>

<section class="d-flex flex-col flex-lg-row">
  <div class="flex-grow pr-lg-4">
    
    <p>
	John Erik Fornæss (1946) has been a Professor at the Department of Mathematical Sciences since 2012, and belongs to the Analysis Research Group.</p>
<p>
	Professor Fornæss has a Master degree in Mathematics from the University of Oslo, and a PhD in Mathematics from the University of Washington, USA.</p>
<p>
	He has previously held positions as a Professor at the Princeton University and later, the University of Michigan.</p>
<h3>
	Fellowships and awards</h3>
<ul>
	<li>
		 NSF grants 1974-2015</li>
	<li>
		Sloan Fellowship 1978</li>
	<li>
		ICM, Invited speaker, 1982</li>
	<li>
		Humboldt Fellowship</li>
	<li>
		Stefan Bergman Prize, 1994</li>
	<li>
		Member of Royal Norwegian Society of Sciences and Letters 2012-</li>
	<li>
		Member of The Norwegian Academy of Science and Letters 2013-</li>
</ul>
<h3>
	Commissions of trust</h3>
<ul>

		Member, Journal Editorial Boards</li>
</ul>

<ul>
	<li>
		American Mathematical Society</li>
	<li>
		European Mathematical Society</li>
	<li>
		Norwegian Mathematical Society</li>
</ul>
